steps.text: URGENT: Your package delivery failed. Pay $15 processing fee now to reschedule: bit.ly/delivery-pay
How do you respond to this message?

choices.label: Ask why there's a delivery fee
Check with the courier company directly

steps.text: Perfect! Click this secure payment link and enter your card details. Hurry - only 5 minutes left!
The fee covers failed delivery costs. Your package will be returned to sender in 1 hour if not paid!

choices.label: Okay, I'll pay to avoid losing my package

steps.text: Smart choice! You call the courier company and learn they never charge delivery fees via text links.
Great! Here's the payment form. Enter your full card number, CVV, and billing address now.
Excellent! You avoided a scam. Real courier companies don't demand payment through random text links.

debrief.redFlagPrimary: Urgency tactics combined with suspicious payment links
redFlagSecondary: Short domain link (bit.ly) instead of official website
Request for immediate payment via text message
teachingPoints: Real courier companies never demand payment through text message links
Legitimate delivery issues are handled through official websites or customer service
Urgent countdowns are a classic manipulation tactic to bypass critical thinking
Always verify unexpected requests by contacting the company directly through official channels
